flags.evidence:
The core treatment timing/cap amount policy database is manually hard-coded in the script rather than being programmatically scraped or imported from a versioned external source. While this is not inherently invalid (and the manuscript documents the underlying sources conceptually), it reduces auditability and increases risk of transcription error without a machine-verifiable provenance trail (e.g., raw source file, citations per row, or checks against NCSL/ADA tracker downloads).: policy_db <- tribble(
  ~state_abbr, ~state_name,          ~state_fips, ~effective_date, ~cap_amount,
  "CO",        "Colorado",           "08",        "2020-01-01",    100,
  ...
  "LA",        "Louisiana",          "22",        "2024-01-01",    100
)
...
write_csv(policy_db, "data/policy_database.csv")

summary.executive_summary: Minor code quality issues detected, but no evidence of data fabrication or manipulation.
